analyzed: dhamma paccanīya duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  niyata duka

original: Naniyataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ.🔽Naaniyataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naaniyato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.
analyzed: na niyatam dhammam paṭicca na niyataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā eka  na aniyatam dhammam paṭicca na aniyataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi
translated: A non-fixed state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a non-fixed state … one …🔽A non-fixed state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a fixed state … one …

original: Naniyatañca naaniyatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naniyato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na niyatam ca na aniyatam ca dhammam paṭicca na niyataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: A non-fixed state is a condition, as root-cause condition, for a non-fixed and a fixed state … one … (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… vipāke ekaṁ …pe… avigate pañca.
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe vipāke ekam pe avigate pañca
translated: In the dyads, there are five in the case of root-cause condition, two in the case of object condition, etc. … one in the case of kamma result condition … five in the case of non-hindrance condition.
